section.name: Description
section.p: A component that provides an HTML-based tree from data supplied by a backing bean. The tree is highly customizable and allows for fine-grained control over the appearance of each of the nodes depending on their type. Almost any type of JSF component (text, image, checkbox, etc.) can be rendered inside the nodes and there is an option for client-side or server-side toggling of the expand/collapse state.

blockquote.code: clientSideToggle [true|false] (default=true) - Perform client-side toggling of expand/collapse state via javascript (default is true.)
showLines [true|false] (default=true) - Show the connecting lines (default is true.)
showNav [true|false] (default=true) - Show the "plus" and "minus" navigation icons (default is true.), Value is ignored if clientSideToggle is true.
showRootNode [true|false] (default=true) - Include the root node when rendering the tree (default is true.)
value [value binding expression] (required) - the tree model.
var - the variable to hold current selection.
preserveToggle - Preserve changes in client-side toggle information between requests (default is true.)

section.name: FAQ
section.p: Q: I'm getting an exception "Invalid bit mask of ..."

A: The renderer is encountering an unexpectd combination of events. One situation is you have a node indicating that is expanded but its a leaf. Make sure you are returning the correct values for the isLeaf method of the TreeNode interface and that you are not toggling the expanded state (in a custom TreeModel, TreeState class, etc.) in an inappropriate manner.
